entity1.name: Autonomous vehicles
entity1.description: Vehicles that can operate without human input, using sensors and software to navigate and drive.;;;Vehicles that are capable of sensing their environment and navigating without human input.;;;Vehicles that can operate without human input, using various sensors and algorithms to navigate and make decisions on the road.;;;A type of autonomous vehicle designed for personal transportation, capable of driving itself without a human driver.;;;A type of technology that enables vehicles to operate without human input, using sensors and software to navigate and drive safely.;;;Vehicles capable of sensing their environment and moving with little or no human input.;;;Complex mathematical models and procedures designed to perform tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as learning, reasoning, and problem-solving.;;;Vehicles that can operate without human input, using various sensors and artificial intelligence systems to navigate and make decisions.;;;Vehicles capable of sensing their environment and navigating without human input.;;;Vehicles capable of sensing their environment and moving safely with little or no human input, often using a combination of sensors, cameras, and AI algorithms.;;;Devices that detect and respond to some type of input from the physical environment, such as light, heat, motion, or pressure.;;;The process of designing, testing, and improving self-driving vehicles.

entity5.name: transportation
entity5.description: The network of routes, vehicles, and facilities used for the movement of people and goods.;;;The business activity of transporting goods or passengers by road, rail, sea, or air.;;;The sector responsible for the movement of people and goods from one place to another.;;;The physical structures and facilities that support vehicular traffic, such as roads, bridges, and traffic signals.;;;The physical structures and facilities that support road transportation, such as roads, bridges, and traffic control systems.
entity5.chunkid: The Future of Autonomous Vehicles3;;;The Future of Autonomous Vehicles8;;;The Future of Autonomous Vehicles30;;;The Future of Autonomous Vehicles25;;;The Future of Autonomous Vehicles9

entity7.name: accidents
entity7.description: Incidents of harm or damage, often occurring unexpectedly and unintentionally, especially in the context of road safety.

entity8.name: World Health Organization
entity8.description: A specialized agency of the United Nations responsible for international public health.

entity9.name: 1.35 million people
entity9.description: The number of individuals who die annually due to road traffic accidents.

entity12.name: cameras
entity12.description: Imaging devices used for recording visual information, often employed in surveillance and autonomous systems to capture real-time video or images.

entity19.name: environment
entity19.description: The natural world in which humans, animals, and plants live.

entity20.name: emissions
entity20.description: Substances released into the air, often as a byproduct of industrial or vehicular processes.

entity21.name: idling vehicles
entity21.description: Vehicles that are running but not moving, typically waiting in traffic or at a stop.

entity22.name: traffic
entity22.description: The movement of vehicles on roads and highways.

entity24.name: shared autonomous fleets
entity24.description: Groups of self-driving vehicles that can be shared among multiple users for transportation purposes.

entity30.name: public trust
entity30.description: The confidence and faith the general population has in a particular system or technology.

entity31.name: acceptance
entity31.description: The act of receiving or approving something, often used to describe societal approval of new technologies or practices.

entity34.name: liability
entity34.description: The state of being legally responsible for one's actions or the consequences thereof, especially in the context of accidents involving autonomous vehicles.

entity35.name: insurance
entity35.description: A system under which individuals or organizations are protected against financial loss in exchange for regular payments to an insurance company, particularly relevant for covering risks associated with autonomous vehicles.

entity36.name: licensing
entity36.description: The process by which a governing body grants permission to individuals or organizations to engage in certain activities, such as operating autonomous vehicles on public roads.

entity37.name: Governments
entity37.description: Organizations that exercise executive, legislative, and judicial authority over a geographic area.;;;Governmental organizations or agencies that provide public services and manage public resources.
entity37.chunkid: The Future of Autonomous Vehicles26;;;The Future of Autonomous Vehicles23

entity38.name: regulatory bodies
entity38.description: Institutions responsible for enforcing rules and regulations within a particular industry or sector.

entity39.name: industry stakeholders
entity39.description: A collective term for individuals, groups, or organizations that have an interest in the operations of a specific industry.

entity46.name: private entities
entity46.description: Companies, corporations, or other business entities that are privately owned and operated for profit.

entity48.name: technology companies
entity48.description: Firms that develop and commercialize technology products or services.

entity50.name: pilot programs
entity50.description: Initial trials or tests conducted to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of a new system or technology.
